solution_line_template: First convert the {years_sentence}-year sentence to months: {years_sentence} years * {months_per_year} months/year = <<{years_sentence}*{months_per_year}={sentence_in_months}>>{sentence_in_months} months
Then add the {assault_months} months for assault: {sentence_in_months} months + {assault_months} months = <<{sentence_in_months}+{assault_months}={total_months_initial}>>{total_months_initial} months

Then find how long the 1/{extension_divisor} extension is: {total_months_initial} months / {extension_divisor} = <<{total_months_initial}/{extension_divisor}={extension_months}>>{extension_months} months

Finally, add up the three lengths of time to find the total sentence length: {total_months_initial} months + {extension_months} months = <<{total_months_initial}+{extension_months}={total_sentence_length}>>{total_sentence_length} months
